newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Pakistan parliament passes president powers bill.
newsitem.headline: Pakistan parliament passes president powers bill.

text.p: The Pakistani parliament passed a constitution amendment bill on Tuesday to curb presidential powers to sack a government and parliament and appoint armed forces chiefs and provincial governors.
The 217-member National Assembly (lower house) adopted the bill 190-0 shortly after the 87-seat Senate (upper house) passed it 79-0 votes.

The passage of the bill, announced by National Assembly speaker Ilahi Bakhsh Soomro, came hours after Prime Minister Nawaz Sharif's cabinet decided to move the amendment to restore supremacy of parliament.

The amendments make dissolving the National Assembly and sacking of a prime minister, the appointment of armed forces chiefs and provincial governors by the president subject to approval from the prime minister.
One amendment also bars provincial governors from dissolving provincial assemblies without approval from their respective chief ministers.
